senses.de: Something that continues for a long time
senses.ex: He gave a lengthy explanation about his absence.

Tips.title: Time Duration
Tips.description: Use 'lengthy' to describe something that takes a lot of time, often more than expected.
Tips.example: The lengthy application process discouraged many candidates.

Tips.title: Potentially Negative
Tips.description: 'Lengthy' can imply that the duration is unnecessarily long or tedious.
Tips.example: They were frustrated by the lengthy delay in the project's completion.

Tips.title: Subjective Perception
Tips.description: What is considered 'lengthy' can vary based on personal expectation.
Tips.example: The movie wasn't long, but it felt lengthy to him.

senses.de: Something that is long in physical length, such as an object or distance
senses.ex: The path in the park is quite lengthy.

Tips.title: Physical Measurement
Tips.description: 'Lengthy' describes physical things that are long from end to end, like roads or objects.
Tips.example: The lengthy table accommodated all the guests for dinner.

Tips.title: Exceeding Normal
Tips.description: Use 'lengthy' if something is long compared to others of its kind, beyond what is usual.
Tips.example: The runner had to prepare for the lengthy race ahead.

Tips.title: Relative Concept
Tips.description: 'Lengthy' can vary in meaning; a lengthy book might be 500 pages, a lengthy meeting two hours.
Tips.example: The team was not prepared for such a lengthy discussion.

Elongate.wordDefinition:
Elongate means to stretch or extend in length while lengthy means of considerable lenght.

Elongate is usually used when something needs to be physically stretched or extended in length, for example, an object or body part.

Extensive.wordDefinition:
Extensive refers to something that is broad in scope or covers a large area or involves many details.

For example: "The team conducted an extensive research on the issue."

Extensive describes the depth or breadth of something, while lengthy describes the duration or amount of time spent on something.

Interminable.wordDefinition:
Interminable means never-ending, without any clear or definite end, or something that seems to go on forever. It usually has a negative connotation and can refer to a situation, conversation, or task that seems tedious or never-ending.

If you want to describe a task or process that seems to never end and feels tedious, you would use 'interminable.' If you want to describe something that takes a lot of time or is just very long, lengthy would be more applicable.

Linger.wordDefinition:
Linger refers to staying in a place or situation longer than necessary.

This word is often used to describe someone who is reluctant to leave a place or move on from a situation, such as someone who lingers at a party or who lingers over a decision.

Lengthy refers to duration or extent, while linger refers to staying in a place or situation longer than necessary.

Prolong.wordDefinition:
Lengthy refers to something that is long in duration or length while prolong refers to extending the duration or length of something.

However, if someone decides to add more scenes to the movie to extend its length, then they are prolonging it.

Lengthy describes something that is long while prolong describes the act of making something longer.

Protracted.wordDefinition:
The words lengthy and protracted both mean something that takes longer than expected.

However, lengthy implies something that is simply long in duration, while protracted often implies that something is longer than it should be or is unnecessarily prolonged.

For example, a lengthy book is simply long in size, while a protracted meeting may feel like it's dragging on and could have been wrapped up sooner.

Lengthy can describe anything that takes a long time, while protracted is more commonly used in situations where time is being wasted, or there is unnecessary delay.

Tire.wordDefinition:
Tire means to feel exhausted or fatigued.

Lengthy describes something that is long, while tire describes a feeling of exhaustion or fatigue. Lengthy is applicable to things like meetings or documents, while tire is applicable to physical or mental exertion.

quotes.Text: At the risk of sounding really corny now, I'm a career prosecutor. I've been doing this for a very long time. And I believe in holding people responsible when they violate the law. But our sole responsibility is to seek justice. And sometimes that means a very lengthy sentence for people who are dangerous and from which society must be protected.
quotes.Title: American Lawyer
quotes.Name: Sally Yates

quotes.Text: After lengthy consideration, my views have evolved sufficiently to support marriage equality legislation. This position doesn't require any religious denomination to alter any of its tenets; it simply forbids government from discrimination regarding who can marry whom.
quotes.Title: American Politician
quotes.Name: Tim Johnson

quotes.Text: I think it's very important to recognize talent in all facets of filmmaking. Making a movie is such a lengthy and intense experience, so it's wonderful to honour actors, directors, producers and all crew members who put so much hard work and passion into a project.
quotes.Title: French Actress
quotes.Name: Eva Green

quotes.Text: I've had lengthy discussions with European farm leaders. It is clear they have an agricultural strategy to support their producers and gain dominance in world agricultural trade. They're gaining markets the old-fashioned way - they're buying them.
quotes.Title: American Politician
quotes.Name: Kent Conrad

quotes.Text: All my books draw heavily on my own experiences, and these are not just places I have gone to on holiday, they're locations I know them intimately from lengthy expeditions, most of which have been spent on the hunt for wildlife.
quotes.Name: Steve Backshall

quotes.Text: In the past, radiation treatment planning has been a very lengthy procedure. Now, with the aid of CT therapy-planning computer programs, we can position the therapy beams automatically with precision in a few minutes.
quotes.Title: English Scientist
quotes.Name: Godfrey Hounsfield

quotes.Text: The advanced levels which the democratic world has attained at the end of lengthy processes may have created the perception in the region that democracy is a distant concept; this perception can be addressed.

quotes.Name: Recep Tayyip Erdogan

quotes.Text: Am I the only one who can't seem to reconcile the grand canyon of cognitive dissonance I feel when people with much more important jobs than I have manage to score much lengthier times off?

quotes.Name: Kevin Bleyer

quotes.Text: I want to have a lengthy career. I want to play interesting characters. I want to tell beautiful stories, complex stories, deep stories.

quotes.Text: There is no point in doing a lengthy role if there is no importance in it.
